channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large groups of black males hanging around all hours taking drugs drinking alcohol this is anti-social behavior and causing upset to surrounding residents and are in fear to go out.When is Hackney Council authority going to do something about this been going on for years off licence causing antisocial behavior also by selling alcohol., 23rd August
item.description:
Criminal activity drug dealing and alcohol consumption on public streets. Antisocial behaviour criminal activity.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradstock Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public tree plant request, 23rd August
item.description:
Hi Bromley council team, Trees provide tremendous benefits to our life. Blandford Road has lovely mature tree line. There is somehow some empty tree slots that can be used to support a new tree’s life. The address is in front of house 442. Many thanks and looking forward to the response. Kind regards, Vuong Nguyen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins on the pavement, 23rd August
item.description:
Recycling and general waste bins on the pavement. My companion had to manoeuvre their wheelchair precariously around the bins getting stuck on the grass verge for a bit too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birling Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Issue with lamppost, 23rd August
item.description:
Someone has hung a flag from the lamppost which is next to the road and a danger to road users as it could come loose. Also offensive symbolism not representing the diverse community
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heathview Drive, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle blocking pavement, 23rd August
item.description:
This vehicle has been here for over 2 weeks, it is a danger to pedestrians who have to walk into the busy road to get past. It needs immediate action to remove and make the pavement safe. I find it unacceptable that this vehicle had been allowed to remain in this position for so long by whoever is responsible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction of Public Footpath, 23rd August
item.description:
Various items, bins and overgrown hedges from number 59 Leesons way are constantly obstructing this footpath and making it unsafe to walk upon. It also makes the area look entirely undesirable. Please could this be addressed as it had been ongoing for a matter of months and isn’t very nice for local residents. I can also see it’s been reported previously and no action has been taken with no reason as to why.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two put out fires next to public pathway and in the woods, 23rd August
item.description:
The fire next to the river and path was surrounded by burnt newspaper pages and other litter. The one in the woods, was the same size and has burnt surrounding trees. This one was also covered in litter, maybe a party was being held in this area. Luckily they were completely out when I came across them, but I could still smell some from the one in the woods. I worry that more will pop up and cause irreparable damage to the area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Oaklands Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vandalism on tunnel with racist language, 23rd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71, Marlborough Park Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London

item.title: Dear sir/ madam The resident of this address 11 Daintry way E9 5JJ has employed two subcontractors to grout and cut out brickwork grooves to re-point. This is causing destruction in the surrounding area noise nuisance dust pollution making people's health conditions bad having to keep all windows and doors closed. The workman ain't even using proper extraction equipment to collect the dust or water sprinklers to keep the environment pollution dust down. This is seriously making people ill in the surrounding areas. There is thick dusk on top of residence cars. Thick build up of brick dust everywhere on rooftops windowsills this is not good for no one. Hackney Council environment health need to address this. This has been going on since 11/08/25 write up to now., 23rd August
item.description:
Dear sir/ madam The resident of this address 11 Daintry way E9 5JJ has employed two subcontractors to grout and cut out brickwork grooves to re-point. This is causing destruction in the surrounding area noise nuisance dust pollution making people's heal

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10 Lime bikes completely blocking pavement, 23rd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3-5, Elephant Lane, Bermondsey, London
